title.jp: Egao to Flash ga Yakamashii / Kore ga Watashi no Jishou Ane desu

synopsis: Cocoa decides to send some pictures of her new friends to her family back home, but Chino is very shy around cameras. Cocoa's mission to capture Chino smiling begins! Meanwhile, Chiya's Japanese sweets shop Ama Usa An is featured in a magazine, alongside several other cafés in the area... but Rabbit House is not among them.

Chino wants to learn how to tell a good ghost story and scare her friends, so when Syaro confides that her house is haunted, she rushes to the scene... but the "ghost" turns out to be something she didn't expect. Later, Chino and Cocoa pay a visit to Rize's mansion and witness just how rich their friend's family is.

It's fine arts month at Chino's school, and on the agenda are a sketching contest and a creative dance recital. Chino and her friends Maya and Megu search the town for subjects to use in their sketches, and to contribute to their dance routine, Chino decides to learn ballet.

title.jp: Kokoa-senpai no Yuuga na Ochakai Tutorial

synopsis: The seasons pass, and all the girls are about to advance to the next grade in school. Perhaps they've grown a bit more mature? At Rize's suggestion, they all go out for afternoon tea at a nice café to celebrate. The next day, for some reason, Cocoa seems to be giving more effort than usual...

title.jp: Hitokuchi de Futsuu no Mochimochi da to Minuita yo

synopsis: Cocoa's sister Mocha is coming to visit! Or she should be, but the wait drags on. Cocoa sets out into town to find her, but with no luck. Mocha, meanwhile, is in the park cuddling a feral rabbit. Will the two sisters find each other?

Cocoa feels as if her older sister Mocha is taking away all her new "little sisters." At the same time, she doesn't want to look like a spoiled baby sister herself, so she begins to distance herself from Mocha...

title.jp: Amaenbou na Ano Ko wa Shabondama no You ni Hakanaku Kieru

synopsis: Cocoa stains her work uniform, but the household washing machine is broken, so she decides to hand-wash her uniform along with Chino's and Rize's. The activity leads Chino to wonder if it's finally time to change the Rabbit House employee uniforms. Later, all the girls get together at Syaro's house for a curry party.

Chiya tells Syaro she had a fight with Cocoa, explaining that she pouted because Cocoa seemed unconcerned about the possibility of their school classes changing. Syaro seeks insight from Rize and Chino, but just then, Chiya receives a challenge letter from Cocoa...

title.jp: Kedama wa Tokkoushi Mujihi na Button wa Hanatareru

synopsis: Chiya tells Chino that there used to be a deep rivalry between the owners of Ama Usa An and Rabbit House, so all of the girls decide to find out whether that's true. Chino takes advantage of a middle school job experience project to work at Ama Usa An for three days and investigate both shops' pasts along with Chiya.

Rize is always helping out various school clubs. One day, she invites Syaro to join her, and the two of them visit several clubs as they investigate the legend of another club helper from the school's past, "Miss Emerald."

All of the girls head out into the mountains for a weekend of relaxing in the great outdoors, with lodging and supplies provided by Rize's dad. However, things seem to keep going wrong one after another...

title.jp: Takaramono wa Kimi no Ketteiteki Shunkan

synopsis: Chino is trying to take pictures of the other girls in their "natural state," but ends up capturing far more silly moments than serious ones. As the girls get back to work after taking plenty of pictures, Cocoa finds something strange tucked behind a framed picture in the café...
